heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 31 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.7°C) and outside temperature (down 1.7°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 8%) and rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (down 144 m) and rainfall (down 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 558.0m higher than yesterday, 208.7m higher than the past week, 144.4m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 696m to 976m and averaged 1392.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (89%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
